fast3d.renderables

Class AdvTriangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.renderables.Triangle
      • fast3d.renderables.AdvTriangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Illuminatable, Renderable

    public class AdvTriangle
extends Triangle
implements Illuminatable
    an advanced version of triangle3d that is illuminatable with any built-in light
    getColor() returns the current visible color
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector2d a2
      the texture-mapping coordinate for edge1
      Vector2d b2
      the texture-mapping coordinate for edge2
      Vector2d c2
      the texture-mapping coordinate for edge3
      boolean illuminateTexture
      determines whether to do lighting calculations if a texture is set in the material (illumination is always done if no texture is set)
      default true
      Material material
      the lighting-color information of the triangles surface
      Vector3d na
      normal-vector at edge 1 if gouraud == true
      Vector3d nb
      normal-vector at edge 2 if gouraud == true
      Vector3d nc
      normal-vector at edge 3 if gouraud == true

      • Fields inherited from class fast3d.renderables.Triangle

        a, b, c

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c)
      calls this constructor, the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
      normal vector as the one of triangle3d
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Material mat)
      call this constructor
      the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Material mat, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      AdvTriangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Vector3d normal)
      call the super constructor
      sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
      for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
      to set ambient, diffuse and specular light colors and the shininess, direct access to the fields is permitted

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      Color getColor() 
      Material getMaterial()
      may return null
      Vector3d getNormal()
      returns a reference of the normal vector used for lighting calculation
      if gouraud == true the result will be already interpolated for the current shading during the render-process
      void invalidateLight()
      sets the current visible color to null so that it will be recalculated on the next render() call
      void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      invalidates the lighting calculation
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
      void revalidateLight(Light... lights)
      called when the renderable has to recalculate the visible in here (for asynchronous calls)
      void rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      invalidates the lighting calculation
      boolean setLogicalTextureCoordinates(Vector2d a, Vector2d b, Vector2d c)
      sets the texture-mapping-coordinates to the given logical ones
      parameters not null
      void setMaterial(Material mat)
      sets the coloring-attributes as describes in the material
      calls invalidateLight()
      void setTextureCoordinates(Vector2d a, Vector2d b, Vector2d c)
      sets the texture-mapping-coordinates to the given absolute ones
      parameters not null
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
      during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdvTriangle

        public AdvTriangle(Vector3d a,
                   Vector3d b,
                   Vector3d c,
                   Vector3d normal)
        call the super constructor
        sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
        for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
        to set ambient, diffuse and specular light colors and the shininess, direct access to the fields is permitted
        Parameters:
        a - the first edge
        b - the second edge
        c - the third edge
        normal - the custom normal vector

      • AdvTriangle

        public AdvTriangle(Vector3d a,
                   Vector3d b,
                   Vector3d c)
        calls this constructor, the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
        normal vector as the one of triangle3d
        Parameters:
        a - the first edge
        b - the second edge
        c - the third edge

      • AdvTriangle

        public AdvTriangle(Vector3d a,
                   Vector3d b,
                   Vector3d c,
                   Color ambient,
                   Color diffuse,
                   Color specular,
                   Color emissive,
                   double shininess,
                   Vector3d normal)
        call the super constructor
        sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
        for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
        Parameters:
        a - the first edge
        b - the second edge
        c - the third edge
        ambient - the color used for ambient lighting
        diffuse - the color used for diffuse lighting (lights extending obstructableLight)
        specular - the color used for specular lighting
        emissive - the color definitely visible at minimum even if no light shines to this
        shininess - the factor for specular lighting
        normal - the custom normal vector

      • AdvTriangle

        public AdvTriangle(Vector3d a,
                   Vector3d b,
                   Vector3d c,
                   Material mat)
        call this constructor
        the normal vector will be orthogonal to this and normalized
        Parameters:
        a - the first edge
        b - the second edge
        c - the third edge
        mat - the used material for this surface (reference)

      • AdvTriangle

        public AdvTriangle(Vector3d a,
                   Vector3d b,
                   Vector3d c,
                   Material mat,
                   Vector3d normal)
        call the super constructor
        sets a custom normal vector for lighting calculation
        for correct lighting the normal vector should be orthogonal to this and normalized
        Parameters:
        a - the first edge
        b - the second edge
        c - the third edge
        mat - the used material for this surface (reference)
        normal - the normal vector used for lighting calculation (reference)

    • Method Detail

      • getNormal

        public Vector3d getNormal()
        returns a reference of the normal vector used for lighting calculation
        if gouraud == true the result will be already interpolated for the current shading during the render-process
        Specified by:
        getNormal in interface Illuminatable
        Overrides:
        getNormal in class Triangle
        Returns:
        a clone vector that is orthogonal to the plate

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Triangle
        Returns:
        true if the given AdvTriangle has an equal normal vector and equal edges
        See Also:
        Triangle.hasEqualEdges(fast3d.renderables.Triangle)

      • shade

        public void shade(Graphics3d s)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Specified by:
        shade in interface Renderable
        Overrides:
        shade in class Triangle
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null

      • render

        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Overrides:
        render in class Triangle
        Parameters:
        g - the 3d-graphics-context to do drawings, not null

        public void setMaterial(Material mat)

        calls invalidateLight()

        public void setTextureCoordinates(Vector2d a,
                                  Vector2d b,
                                  Vector2d c)
        sets the texture-mapping-coordinates to the given absolute ones
        parameters not null
        Parameters:
        a - absolute textureCoordinate for edge1
        b - absolute textureCoordinate for edge2
        c - absolute textureCoordinate for edge3
        See Also:

      • setLogicalTextureCoordinates

        public boolean setLogicalTextureCoordinates(Vector2d a,
                                            Vector2d b,
                                            Vector2d c)
        sets the texture-mapping-coordinates to the given logical ones
        parameters not null
        Parameters:
        a - logical textureCoordinate for edge1
        b - logical textureCoordinate for edge2
        c - logical textureCoordinate for edge3
        Returns:
        whether the logical coordinates were set, false if no texture is set in the material
        See Also:
        setTextureCoordinates(Vector2d, Vector2d, Vector2d)
